III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged staff did not intervene quick enough between two
youth who were able to hit each other.
1

Investigation I spoke Administrator 1 on 1/8/24. Allegations were discussed.
There is no video of the incident.
I conducted interviews face to face at the facility on 1/10/24.
I left a voicemail for Complaint 1 on 1/11/24.
Interviews:
I spoke with Administrator 1 on 1/8/24. Allegations were
discussed. No new information was provided.
I conducted the following interviews face to face at the facility on
1/10/24.
Administrator 2:
Administrator 2 reported she was working on site on 1/4/24 but
was not present for the actual incident. Administrator 2 reported
she responded to an “assistance call” from Staff 1. Administrator 2
reported when she arrived the situation was diffused and no one
was being restrained. Administrator 2 reported she arrived at the
unit within minutes of the assistance call. After she arrived, she
placed an extra staff, Staff 2 on the unit with Staff 1 for the
remainder of the night. Administrator 2 reported they debriefed
each youth individually, then brought them back together to
discuss the situation. They provided medical for the youth as well.
Therapist 1:
Therapist 1 reported she had completed group therapy in the unit.
There were no issues in the group. She had left the common area
when Staff 1 came in for the evening and went into the office.
During the transition of staff, the unit was starting their dinner
routine, youth all seated, using the restroom one by one. Shortly
after that she heard yelling and came back into the unit to see
Staff 1 in a Child Hold position with Youth A and the rest of the
unit was moved to the side. Therapist 1 reported she took the
other youth into the group room and helped them with breathing
exercises and debriefing of the situation. Therapist 1 reported
Administrator 1 and Supervisor 1 came into the unit to help.
Therapist 1 reported extra staff where there minutes after the
incident.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported she went to the unit for her shift and started to
complete the dinner routine. All the youth were seated in the
common area, quietly using the restroom one by one. Staff 1
2

reported she was starting to make dinner. Youth A went to the
restroom and while she was returning from the restroom, Youth B
got up and started to hit her. Staff 1 reported she immediately
called for assistance and then ran to them and completed a Child
Hold on Youth B. She was able to get the hold and then they fell
to the ground. Therapist 1 had the rest of the unit go into the
group room away from the incident and assistance came within
minutes to help. Staff 1 reported Youth A did not attempt to attack
Youth B while she had Youth B in the Child Hold. Staff 1 reported
Administrator 1 and Supervisor 1 were in the unit within minutes.
Staff 1 reported they debriefed the youth after the incident and
checked both Youth A and Youth B for any medical needs.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported he headed to the unit when he heard a call
for “assistance” from Staff 1. Supervisor 1 reported he ran to the
unit and was there within minutes. Supervisor 1 reported when he
was there the youth were already sitting on the couch and
deescalated. Supervisor 1 reported they debriefed the youth and
had them talk together. Supervisor 1 reported Administrator 1 had
him stay in the unit to assist throughout the night just in case the
issue was not dissolved. Supervisor 1 reported they checked the
youth to make sure they did not need medical attention.
Youth A and Youth B Interviews:
Youth A and Youth B were interviewed separately. Both Youth A
and Youth B reported after group therapy they got into a fight.
Both stated they were sitting quietly in the common area using the
restrooms while Staff 1 prepared dinner. Both reported Staff 1
responded quickly to their fight and restrained Youth B. Both
reported they were debriefed individually and then together. Both
reported that staff made sure they were physically okay from the
fight. Both reported Supervisor 1 and Administrator 1 were there
as well as Therapist 1. Both reported Supervisor 1 stayed in the
unit the rest of the night.
Complainant 1
I left a voicemail for Complaint 1 on 1/11/24. As of the 1/24/24 of
this report, communication has not been received.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the incident reports, medical documentation and
debriefing forms. All forms were completed in its entirety and
confirm the interviews noted.
There is no video of the incident.
3

Analysis There is no evidence to validate staff did not respond quickly to
the altercation. Based on interviews with staff and youth, the staff
responded immediately by calling for assistance and immediately
engaging in a CPI hold. The youth were separated, deescalated,
and debriefed. All medical needs were completed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
